title: LG Display books first operating loss in six years as panel prices drop
text:
April 24, 2018 / 11:34 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago LG Display reports first quarter operating loss as panel prices drop Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SEOUL (Reuters) - South Koreaâ€™s LG Display Co Ltd reported its first quarterly operating loss in six years, hit by a sharp drop in panel prices as Chinese rivals flooded the market and sluggish sales of liquid crystal displays for TVs. FILE PHOTO: A 77-inch LG Signature W OLED television is displayed during the 2017 CES in Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S., January 5, 2017. REUTERS/Steve Marcus/File Photo 
The Apple Inc supplier posted an operating loss of 98 billion won ($91.1 million) for January-March. That compares with a 1 trillion won profit in the same period a year ago and an average forecast of a 58.1 billion won loss drawn from 14 analysts polled by Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S. 
Revenue fell 19.6 percent to 5.7 trillion won. 
($1 = 1,076.1500 won)
